comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masurian_Lake_District "The Masurian Lake District or Masurian Lakeland (Polish: Pojezierze Mazurskie; German: Masurische Seenplatte) is a lake district in northeastern Poland ", "The Lakeland extends roughly 290 km (180 mi) eastwards from the lower Vistula to the Poland–Russia border" and "In modern times, while part of the German Empire, it was the location of the First Battle of the Masurian Lakes (1914) and the Second Battle of the Masurian Lakes (1915) during World War I."

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This was a very bad patch of land to be around in the winter of 1915.

comment.author: 90012207@N08
comment._content: More information about masurian lake district you can find on: www.e-mazury.com.pl

comment.author: 14725550@N04
comment._content: This photo could be taken in former Russian barracks in Augustów or Suwałki. These towns are located in Suwalszczyzna - a region next to Masuria, on the east. Current view (in Augustów): commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Former_barracks_in_August...
